data.title: Some Unique Architectural Works in Danang
data.description: Da Nang has many unique architectural works that you should visit. One of them is the Dragon Bridge, which is a symbol of Da Nang. The city's Dragon Bridge is a symbol of Da Nang, and the nearby Museum of Cham Sculpture displays art from the ancient Cham civilization.
data.author: LPeter Parker

data.title: Top 5 Best Places to Visit in Da Nang, Vietnam
data.description: Here are the top 5 best places to visit in Da Nang, Vietnam. You should visit the Marble Mountains, five limestone outcrops that are home to pagodas and caves containing Buddhist shrines. The city's Dragon Bridge is a symbol of Da Nang, and the nearby Museum of Cham Sculpture displays art from the ancient Cham civilization.
data.author: Traveler's Digest

data.title: First Time travel to Da Nang – Things you need to know
data.description: Here are some tips for first-time travelers to Da Nang, Vietnam. Da Nang is a coastal city in central Vietnam known for its sandy beaches and history as a French colonial port. It's a popular base for visiting the inland Bà Nà hills to the west of the city. Here the Hải Vân Pass has views of Da Nang Bay and the Marble Mountains, five limestone outcrops that are home to pagodas and caves containing Buddhist shrines. The city's Dragon Bridge is a symbol of Da Nang, and the nearby Museum of Cham Sculpture displays art from the ancient Cham civilization.
data.author: Vietnam Travel Tips
